So something like this?

~~~
diff -r 87cfed357da4 cmake/Export.hh.in
--- a/cmake/Export.hh.in	Wed Dec 06 17:51:41 2017 +0000
+++ b/cmake/Export.hh.in	Mon Dec 18 18:34:14 2017 -0800
@@ -58,7 +58,20 @@
 /// that a function or class has been deprecated and should no longer be used.
 /// A version should be specified to provide context to the user about when the
 /// function became deprecated.
-#define IGN_DEPRECATED(version) IGN_DEPRECATED_ALL_VERSIONS
+  #if defined(__GNUC__)
+    #define IGN_DEPRECATED(version) __attribute__((deprecated))
+    #define IGN_FORCEINLINE __attribute__((always_inline))
+  #elif defined(_WIN32)
+    // IGN_DEPRECATED should be defined as something like
+    // __declspec(deprecated), but it needs to go *before* the function name,
+    // and we're putting IGN_DEPRECATED *after* the function.
+    #define IGN_DEPRECATED(version)
+    #define IGN_FORCEINLINE __forceinline
+  #else
+    #define IGN_DEPRECATED(version) ()
+    #define IGN_FORCEINLINE
+  #endif
 #endif
 
+
 #endif
~~~
